title: epixs logotype
content:
here is my personal logo for the EPIXS brand

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140809101503im_/http:/typophile.com/files/119_6013.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140809101503im_/http:/typophile.com/files/118_4151.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140809101503im_/http:/typophile.com/files/120_5828.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140809101503im_/http:/typophile.com/files/121_6527.jpg)
author: epixs

comments.content: What does this represent? What brand I mean? It is very gothic. I like it, but wonder what it represents.

looks like a modified E/3 to me Tiff.

and ... can you make it bigger?

----------  
**Paul Ducco**  
 [Graphic Design](http://web.archive.org/web/20140809101503/http:/www.solid-creative.com/)

Reminds me of the Carrefour logo.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140809101503im_/http:/typophile.com/files/carrefour_5039.png)

it is not exactly a brand name (EPIXS) in fact it is more personal label than anything else - with this logo I will sign all my designs to certify they are my work...

Ratbaggy was right - it comes from negative of E/3 trimmed from a 45° rotated square:-)

Miguel Sousa - you are right - it reminds of that logo, but i think I can live with that:-)))

[www.behance.net/epixs](http://web.archive.org/web/20140809101503/http:/www.behance.net/epixs "www.behance.net/epixs")  
 [epixs@yahoo.com](mailto:epixs@yahoo.com)  
+359887323000

Looks terrific!

My first association was "France", but I'm not entirely sure why that is. I think I've seen it in French crests etc. before. Seems to be like a national icon or something? And Carrefour is a French company after all. Funny coincidence...

[Webdesign Hamburg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140809101503/http:/www.designbits.de/)

It's a fleur-de-lis and is a french emblem used on the quebec flag among many other places. Look it up on wikipedia for more info :)

penn
